metadata.Title: CVE-2021-3621 on Ubuntu 14.04 ESM (trusty) - medium.
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in SSSD, where the sssctl command was vulnerable to shell command injection via the logs-fetch and cache-expire subcommands. This flaw allows an attacker to trick the root user into running a specially crafted sssctl command, such as via sudo, to gain root access. The highest threat from this vulnerability is to confidentiality, integrity, as well as system availability.

notes.Note: leosilva> vulnerability was introduced in v1.13.91 by commit: https://github.com/SSSD/sssd/commit/e157b9f6cb370e1b94bcac2044d26ad66d640fba xenial/esm is not-affected as it is based on 1.13.4-1 and so, code affected is not present.

criterions.comment: sssd: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
